explanation:
The claim is not demonstrably correct from the provided code alone. In MHD_check_response_header_token_ci the header and value members are only read (they are passed to comparison functions), so within this function they could be treated as const; however MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 concerns the declarations of pointer types. The struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header declares header and value as char *; whether that violates 8.13 depends on whether any code in the whole code base ever modifies the pointed-to characters. If the pointed-to data is legitimately mutable somewhere (e.g. other functions write into header or value, or the API is designed to allow modification), keeping char * is appropriate. Also note that MHD_check_response_header_token_ci takes a pointer to a const struct, so it cannot modify those members through that parameter even if they are non-const in the struct definition.

Therefore, with only the snippets shown, you cannot conclude there is a MISRA 8.13 violation. If an audit of the entire code base shows header/value are never modified, then the struct fields should be changed to const char * to comply with 8.13. Otherwise the current declaration may be justified.
